titleStmt.title: Christ Harle et al. to Unknown
CWG9391

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned citizen of Indianapolis and State of Indiana certify that we are acquainted with Albert Hurt, that he was raised here in this place where he also was apprenteced or learned the trade of Baker, that we have him all the time known as a good behaved boy and never quilty of any criminal act not even of any mischief but that he was rather easily guided by others, and if he should have been guilty of any crime, it is our certain belief that he would have got only into it by persuasion and coxing by different persons, and not of his own will

Christ Harle
